The UN General Assembly has approved increased funding for missions in Cote d'Ivoire and Haiti for the year ending June 2022. This decision aligns with a Security Council resolution to bolster UN peacekeeping missions in these regions.

A bronze statue of martial arts icon Bruce Lee was unveiled in the ethnically divided city of Mostar in Bosnia-Herzegovina. The unveiling took place a day before a second statue of him was revealed in Hong Kong to commemorate his birthday.
British aid worker Norman Kember has been kidnapped in Iraq along with three other Westerners, according to the British Foreign Office.
A senior health official has stated that migrants should be considered a high-risk group for HIV/AIDS infection and should receive more attention from the government.
Indonesia's manufacturing industry growth rate has been slowing down during the first three quarters of the year, despite still expanding at a relatively fast pace, according to a local report.
A Mozambican man suspected of murdering Jorge, the director of Maputo Central Prison, has escaped from the city's police headquarters, according to local media reports.
The US dollar dropped to a lower level against the yen in Tokyo on Wednesday, after it failed to break through a significant yen barrier where many options-related yen-buying orders were placed.
The UN Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs, Ibrahim Gambari, stated on Wednesday that despite a hopeful outlook for the Middle East peace process, it still faces significant challenges.
